Name: Easter cocktail
Ingredients: 30 ml Dutch Cacao white crème de cacao
5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
15 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: MUDDLE cardamom pods in base of shaker. Add other ingredients, SHAKE with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and fine strain into chilled glass.
Review: Chocolate cocktail with extra interest thanks to vanilla and cardamom.
History: Created in 2003 by Simon King at MJU Bar, Millennium Hotel, London, England. The egg white was our addition to Simon's recipe - it seemed appropriate to add egg given this is an Easter cocktail. We also added the orange zest nest of chocolate eggs.
Garnish: Dust with chocolate powder &/or crumbled Cadbury's Flake bar, & mini chocolate eggs in orange zest nest on rim.
